definition[0]: the state of being freed from the power of evil, believed by Christians to be made possible by Jesus Christ
definition[1]: the act of exchanging a piece of paper worth a particular amount of money for money, goods, or services
definition[2]: the exchange of shares, bonds etc for money
definition[3]: an occasion when shares, bonds etc are exchanged for cash from the organization that sold them and made them available
example[0]: The table sets out the amount payable on redemption.
example[1]: the redemption value of a security
example[2]: Analysts expect another large volume of early redemptions of municipal bonds.
definition[4]: the act of paying off a loan or debt
